originalText: jy_kohlmeier
Start Element
kohlmeier
Go to hell!
Any luck?

::You see an elderly, dried-up man eating some raw mushrooms, taking them one by one from his palm until it is completely empty of everything but a thick layer of hardened skin. He stares at you, still chewing through the last mushroom, and after swallowing it, he speaks.::

Hey, stranger. I... can see you are not from around here. ::He pauses, and his stare wanders around. Then he continues.:: Might you, by any chance, be interested in a little business proposition?
You are back.
context.quest_jyluckyKnife_keptKnife
Here's your knife, old timer. ::Give him the knife.::
Yeah, I found it, and it turns out it's a pretty good knife so I'm keeping it.
Sorry, I looked everywhere but couldn't find your knife.
Tell me something about yourself, old timer.
Still working on it.
context.npc_jykohlmeier_met
What did you have in mind, old timer?
Sorry. I don't deal with hobos.
Maybe some other time.
Tell me what you had in mind.
You got yourself a deal.
No, just passing by.
Weapon.LuckyKnife
Hee-hee, my old lucky knife! I thought I'd never see you again!
Weapon.LuckyKnife
jy_luckyKnife
jy_luckyKnife
What? You greedy bastard! I hope you fall over and stab yourself!
jy_luckyKnife
That... bastard must have sold it at some point. I waited too long. I should have gone looking for it myself earlier. Curse these old bones!
Why are you interested in knowing more about an old man like me?
::He nods.::
::He beckons you closer.:: I didn't always live in a tent, you know. I used to live in the residential area to the east. Really, I did.
Hee-hee! You'll be very lonely here in the Junkyard then.
::He nods.:: I ain't going nowhere, if you change your mind.
Great. So about getting in... *Obviously,* you could try the front door if you think you can hack the lock, but it's also being watched by the Eels.
Well, I'll leave you two to catch up.
I'll be careful, don't worry. Bye, old fart.
Well, that's that, old timer. I wish you the very best.
Tough. Bye.
Older, I'd say.
Just wanted to hear your story. You told me about the house, so why not go back in past some more.
Hmmm, good question. I guess I'll leave you be then. So long, old timer.

I lived in a comfy house on the east side. Oh, yeah. But, one day I couldn't pay protection money to the Eels anymore so they kicked me out. Heartless bastards. However, I'm not gonna waste your time with my... sob story, no.
I'm sure of it. See you around.
Got it. Bye, old timer.

The smart thing to do would be to go to the docks and look for the small shack north of the berths. ::He nods.:: The rocks between the shack and the cave wall can *actually* be dislodged there without breaking a sweat, and you look skinny enough to squeeze through. Not saying you're a squeezer, mind you, just that you're... thin enough. That's all.
Hey... thanks. Best of luck, youngster.
::He nods.:: Yeah, I wish it too...

::He laughs.:: Old. There's no use in trying to kid ourselves. I mean, us old folks. We're old, and we're gonna be gone soon. Old-er, that's the word those who don't wanna accept the way life works, with all it's ups... and downs.

Well... my life was one that had *quite* a few ups and downs. I'd rather not go into too many details, but I had a great wife, a good job, decent kids and a life I wouldn't complain about. First I lost my wife, then I lost my job, then my kids left... then I started complaining about life. ::He smiles.::
Huh?
The important... bit is that I know a secret way back into my old home. And I also know that its current occupant has quite a bit of coins lying around there.

That'll give you access to a tunnel that will lead you straight into the mushroom garden of my old house. I discovered this passage one day when I found a stinkin' rathound messing up my shrooms. Never got around to sealing it off.
You're welcome, and you too, old timer. Goodbye.
I see. So, are you going to tell me something about yourself. You told me about the house, so why not go back in past some more.
I get what you're saying, but I gotta go. See you around, old timer.
What happened?
So you'll tell me how to get in there in exchange for a cut of the profits?
So what would you want in return for this information?
Speaking of that, there still might be rathounds in there, so tread carefully.

I... said I wouldn't wanna get into too many details. Some of the things were my fault, some were bad luck. In the end, I ended up in Junkyard. And then after that, in an even worse part of Junkyard. I guess ground's next. ::He laughs.:: Well, to be honest, at least these United Stations bozos were helping us up until South Railroad Outpost was attacked.

I... said I wouldn't wanna get into too many details. Some of the things were my fault, some were bad luck. In the end, I ended up in Junkyard. And then after that, in an even worse part of Junkyard. I guess ground's next. ::He laughs.:: Well, to be honest, at least these United Stations bozos are helping us out a bit.
What? Do you think I'm thick? I have no way of making you give me any of that money after the job is done.

The only thing I want is for you to get my lucky knife. It's gotta be lying around somewhere in there. The knife won't be of much use to... *you* since it's not a particularly good knife for combat, but it's of sentimental value to me. Do you dig?
Alright. I'm off.
Have the United Stations been treating you well?
Where does the knife fit in?
I'm sorry to hear that. Can I help you somehow? Do you need any food?
Life's tough. I'll be going now, old timer.
What do you say? We got a deal?

Yes. Yes, indeed they have. I was in the same... boat as a lot of the folks in Junkyard when we first heard them... eh, Northerners were gonna construct an embassy here. But, I have a different opinion now. They've been good to us folks here. They give us food and old clothes we can wear, and we're a bit safer here. Although, once you get past Vince and his pack you're back in dangerous territory.
Somewhere in between. Just having it helped me get through... some of the downs in my life. That's all you need to know.
We're good. The United Station folks help us with that. I'd just like that knife. That's all I want.
Deal. Now tell me how to get in there.
I'll have to think about it.

Although, no one left the embassy ever since the South Railroad Outpost was attacked. But I'm sure Protectorate will take care of the Drones sometime soon. They *can't* hold it, you know. Then I think things'll normalize a bit.
Oh, well. That's Junkyard.
Look, can I help you out somehow? Do you need any food?
I see. I gotta go. See you later.
